subject: Legion of Merit Ceremony - 1 DEC - COL Martinez Retirement
bodyPreview: Sir, this is to inform you that COL Maria Martinez will be awarded the Legion of Merit in recognition of her distinguished service during her 28-year career. The ceremony is scheduled for 1 December at 1400 hours at the Pentagon Auditorium. Your attendance as presenting officer would be greatly appreciated.

body.content:
Sir,

This is to inform you that COL Maria Martinez will be awarded the Legion of Merit in recognition of her distinguished service during her 28-year career with the United States Army.

Event Details:

Date:1 December 2025
Time:1400 Hours (2:00 PM)
Location:Pentagon Auditorium, Room 2E579
The Pentagon, Washington, DC
Ceremony Type:Retirement & Award Presentation
Dress:Army Service Uniform (ASU)
Expected Duration:45 minutes

About COL Martinez:

COL Maria Martinez is retiring after 28 years of exceptional service to the Army. Throughout her career, she has demonstrated outstanding leadership, technical expertise, and dedication to mission success. Her assignments have included:

  • Battalion Commander, 3rd Battalion, 75th Ranger Regiment
  • Chief of Staff, Joint Special Operations Command
  • Director, Strategic Plans Division, HQDA G-3/5/7
  • Executive Officer, XVIII Airborne Corps
  • Multiple company and staff officer positions in airborne, mechanized, and special operations units

Her operational deployments include three combat tours in Afghanistan, two in Iraq, and multiple training missions supporting partner nations in Africa and South America.

Legion of Merit Citation Highlights:

"For exceptionally meritorious conduct in the performance of outstanding services and achievements. COL Martinez distinguished herself through exemplary leadership, strategic vision, and unwavering commitment to the United States Army. Her innovative approaches to joint operations planning, force modernization initiatives, and personnel development programs have had lasting impact on Army readiness and effectiveness. COL Martinez's selfless dedication to duty, mentorship of junior officers, and tireless efforts to improve operational capabilities reflect great credit upon herself, the United States Army, and the Department of Defense."

Your Role:

We respectfully request your attendance as the presenting officer for this award. Your presence would add significant meaning to this ceremony given:

  • COL Martinez served as your Executive Officer during your previous assignment
  • You have firsthand knowledge of her contributions to strategic operations planning
  • Your mentorship played a key role in her professional development

Ceremony Program:

  1. 1355 - Guests Arrive (Pentagon Auditorium)
  2. 1400 - Ceremony Begins
    • Posting of Colors
    • National Anthem
    • Invocation
  3. 1410 - Opening Remarks
    • LTG Davidson, Deputy Chief of Staff G-3/5/7
  4. 1415 - Career Tribute Video
    • 5-minute video highlighting COL Martinez's career
  5. 1420 - Award Presentation
    • Citation Reading: LTC Rodriguez (Awards Branch Chief)
    • Award Presentation: General Officer (You)
    • Remarks: COL Martinez
  6. 1435 - Reception Line & Family Recognition
    • Introduction of family members
    • Photo opportunities
  7. 1445 - Closing
    • Benediction
    • Retirement of Colors
    • Army Song

Post-Ceremony Reception:

A reception will be held immediately following the ceremony in the Pentagon Officers' Athletic Club (POAC) from 1500-1700 hours. Light refreshments will be served. Approximately 75 guests expected, including:

  • Family members (spouse, two children, parents, siblings)
  • Senior Army leadership
  • Former commanders and colleagues
  • JSOC representatives
  • Ranger Regiment delegation

Administrative Details:

  • RSVP: Please confirm your attendance by 25 NOV to facilitate security clearances and seating arrangements
  • Pentagon Access: We will coordinate your escort from the River Entrance
  • Parking: Reserved parking space will be available (Pentagon North Parking)
  • Award Certificate: Will be prepared in your name as presenting officer
  • Photography: Official Army photographer will be present; photos will be provided to COL Martinez and your office
  • Media: No media coverage is planned (private ceremony)

Points of Contact:

Ceremony Coordination:LTC James Rodriguez
Chief, Awards & Decorations Branch
Phone: (703) 695-XXXX
Email: james.rodriguez@perscom.army.mil
Protocol:MAJ Sarah Chen
Pentagon Protocol Office
Phone: (703) 697-XXXX
Email: sarah.chen@hqda.army.mil
Security/Access:CPT Michael Thompson
Pentagon Force Protection
Phone: (703) 614-XXXX
Email: michael.thompson@pfpa.mil

Award Details:

  • Award: Legion of Merit (Legionnaire of Merit - Officer Degree)
  • Authority: Title 10, USC, Section 1121
  • Approval Authority: Secretary of the Army
  • Orders Number: 345-28, Headquarters, Department of the Army
  • Effective Date: 1 December 2025

Suggested Talking Points (if you present the award):

  • Highlight COL Martinez's exceptional leadership during combat operations
  • Note her contributions to strategic planning and force modernization
  • Acknowledge her mentorship of junior officers and NCOs
  • Recognize her family's sacrifice and support throughout her career
  • Emphasize the lasting impact of her service on Army readiness
  • Wish her well in retirement and future endeavors

Background Information:

COL Martinez is retiring to pursue a second career in the private sector. She has accepted a position as Vice President of Strategic Operations with a defense contractor in Northern Virginia. She and her family will remain in the DC area.

Request for Confirmation:

Please confirm your attendance by 25 November 2025 by replying to this email or calling my office. If you are unable to attend, please let us know as soon as possible so we can coordinate an alternate presenting officer.

COL Martinez specifically requested that you present this award, given your mentorship and the professional relationship you developed during her time as your Executive Officer. Your attendance would be deeply meaningful to her and her family.

Thank you for your consideration and continued support of Army personnel recognition programs.

Respectfully,

LTC James Rodriguez
Chief, Awards and Decorations Branch
U.S. Army Human Resources Command
Office: (703) 695-XXXX
Mobile: (703) 555-XXXX
james.rodriguez@perscom.army.mil

Classification: UNCLASSIFIED
Event Code: RETMT-2025-1201-MARTINEZ
"Service Before Self - Leadership Through Example"
